gacha_rate_info_intro1.content:
In compliance with the 「Voluntary Restraint Guidelines of Korea Association of Game Industry」, detailed rates for chance-based items are disclosed here.

Individual rates are rounded up from the fifth digit after the decimal point. The actual sum is applied as 100%.

gacha_rate_info_intro2.content:
In [10 Extractions], at least 1 Identity with a rarity of 2★ or higher will be extracted.

The table for the 10th Extraction is as follows:

gacha_rate_info_ego1.content:
Below is the list of Identities and E.G.O you can obtain following the aforementioned rates.

The list may change in certain seasons; upcoming changes to the reward tables will be announced in advance.

gacha_rate_info_ego2.content: E.G.O is extracted non-repetitively; E.G.O acquired through any means, including Extraction, Dispenser, and redemption from the mailbox, will be excluded from the Extraction table. As long as there is E.G.O remaining in the table of possible results, the chance of extracting E.G.O in Extraction does not change. Therefore, the chance of acquiring specific E.G.O will increase as more extractions are performed.

gacha_rate_info_complete1.content: If there is no E.G.O remaining in the table due to the user acquiring all of them, the rates for [1 Extraction] and [10 Extraction] will change accordingly to the following:

gacha_rate_info_complete2.content:
In Target Extractions, certain Identities and E.G.O have higher extraction rates.

Target Identities account for 50% of the probabilities for their respective rarities; the rates are evenly shared among them.

The other 50% of probabilities are evenly distributed between the non-targeted Identities in the table.

gacha_rate_info_complete3.content:
The same applies to Target E.G.O.

Changes in probabilities for Target Extractions do not affect the chances of items of certain types and rarities appearing.

gacha_rate_info_piece1.content:
★ Egoshards
When you extract an Identity or E.G.O you already own, you will get Egoshards of the character, its quantity depending on the item’s type and rarity.

gacha_rate_info_piece2.content:
Egoshards can only be used for a set period. When the expiration date arrives, 50% of the Egoshards in possession are carried over to the next season.

The remaining Egoshards are converted to Thread.

gacha_rate_info_piece3.content:
The same applies to Egoshard Crates.

Players will be notified of the upcoming season change and expiration of Egoshards and Egoshard Crates sometime before the expiration date.

DanteNote_Main.content:
I’m not sure where to even start.
I guess it’s only natural, given that I can’t tell how much I forgot to begin with.
Maybe I’ll start by making notes whenever I run into things I don’t remember.

tutorial_mainui_01_selection_page_01_des.content: You can configure a Team from your 12 Sinners and their Identities.

tutorial_mainui_01_selection_page_02_des.content: In 'Sinners' window, selecting a Sinner's Identity portrait will show a list of their Identities. From there, you can choose an Identity to deploy.

tutorial_mainui_01_selection_page_03_des.content: Selecting the top part of a Sinner's Identity portrait will show a list of their Identities. From there, you can select an Identity to deploy.

tutorial_mainui_01_selection_page_04_des.content: Selecting the bottom part of a Sinner's Identity portrait will deploy that Identity to this battle.
This shows the total number of deployable Identities for this battle.

tutorial_mainui_01_selection_page_05_des.content: You will not be able to edit your Team in certain battle encounters. In those cases, selecting a Sinner's Identity portrait will deploy that Identity to battle.

tutorial_mainui_01_selection_page_06_des.content: In all Team menus, you can press and hold on an Identity portrait to view detailed information on that Sinner's currently equipped Identity & E.G.O.

tutorial_mainui_01_selection_page_07_des.content: Select this button to view your Battle Announcers list.
You can choose which Battle Announcers to accompany you in battle.

tutorial_mainui_01_selection_page_08_des.content: Select from the list of keywords to choose a name for your Team.

tutorial_mainui_01_selection_page_09_des.content: You can view the following information here: All Identities' Skill Attack Types, Sin Affinities, and equipped E.G.O.

tutorial_mainui_01_selection_page_10_des.content: Here, you can view the types and amounts of E.G.O Costs your team can gain in battle.
Select it, and you can view Identities that gain the E.G.O Costs and E.G.O that use them.

tutorial_mainui_02_identitylist_page_01_.content: Your Sinner’s Identities are shown here. You can check their Grades, Uptie Tiers, Levels, and Factions.

tutorial_mainui_02_identitylist_page_02_.content: You can see both the Identities and E.G.O set for the team here. One E.G.O can be registered for each grade.

tutorial_mainui_02_identitylist_page_03_.content: Tapping this button brings you to the list of E.G.O that can be equipped on the slot.

tutorial_mainui_02_identitylist_page_04_.content: You can view the E.G.O’s grade, Threadspin Tier, main attribute, and name.

tutorial_mainui_02_identitylist_page_05_.content: Upon selection, a list of your friends’ support Identities is shown.
Support Identities and E.G.O registered by friends are shown here.

tutorial_mainui_02_identitylist_page_06_.content: You can borrow a friend’s Identity and E.G.O to assist you. Note that you may only have one support Identity on your team at a time.

tutorial_mainui_03_identityinfo_page_01_.content: Levelling up an Identity increases its stats.
Higher Uptie tiers will enhance existing Skills or unlock new Skills.

tutorial_mainui_03_identityinfo_page_02_.content: The Identity's Max HP, Speed Range, Defense Level and its modifier are displayed here.
The Identity's Resistances are displayed here.

tutorial_mainui_03_identityinfo_page_03_.content: The Identity's equipped E.G.O and unlocked Skills are displayed here.

tutorial_mainui_03_identityinfo_page_04_.content: Each Identity has Skills of various functions. You can view the details about them here.

tutorial_mainui_03_identityinfo_page_05_.content: Identities deployed in battle can activate their Passives. At the start of every turn, Passives will activate when their conditions are met.

tutorial_mainui_03_identityinfo_page_06_.content: Identities not deployed in battle can activate their Support Passives. At the start of every turn, Support Passives will activate when their conditions are met.

tutorial_mainui_03_identityinfo_page_07_.content: The color of each Skill Icon corresponds to a Sin Affinity of the same color. These are the following Sin Affinities: Wrath, Lust, Sloth, Gluttony, Gloom, Pride, and Envy.

tutorial_mainui_03_identityinfo_page_08_.content: On the bottom of a Skill Icon is its Attack Type. These are the following Attack Types: Slash, Pierce, and Blunt.
On the left of a Skill Icon is its Base Power.
On the top of a Skill Icon is its Coin Power. These are the following Coin Power calculations: Plus, Minus, and Multiply.

tutorial_mainui_03_identityinfo_page_09_.content: The number of Coins for this Skill is displayed here.
This indicates how many copies of the Skill are in the Identity's Skillset.
The Skill's Offense Level and its modifier are displayed here. The difference in the Attack Skill's Offense Level and the target's Defense Level can greatly affect the amount of damage dealt.

tutorial_mainui_03_identityinfo_page_10_.content: The Skill's Atk Weight is displayed here. Higher Atk Weight will target more enemies. (e.g. 1 Atk Weight will target 1 enemy, 3 Atk Weight will target 3 enemies)

tutorial_mainui_03_identityinfo_page_11_.content: Skills may have effects that activate when the stated conditions are met.
Skills may have effects that activate when the stated Coin conditions(e.g. Heads Hit, Tails Hit) are met. Coin effects will not activate when the conditions aren't met.

tutorial_mainui_04_egoinfo_page_01_desc_.content: Higher Threadspinning Tiers will enhance the E.G.O's Skills and abilities.

tutorial_mainui_04_egoinfo_page_02_desc_.content: The E.G.O's Resistances are displayed here. If an Identity has used an E.G.O Skill, its Resistances will be overwritten by the used E.G.O's Resistances.
The amount of SP spent when using this E.G.O Skill is displayed here.
E.G.O resources required to use this E.G.O Skill are displayed here.

tutorial_mainui_04_egoinfo_page_03_desc_.content: E.G.O Skills have high Base/Coin Power values and potent Skill effects. Details about the E.G.O Skill are displayed here.

tutorial_mainui_04_egoinfo_page_04_desc_.content: If an Identity with a low SP value uses an E.G.O Skill, there is a chance that a much more powerful E.G.O Corrosion Skill will be activated instead. Using E.G.O Corrosion Skills carries a risk, however, as it attacks indiscriminately and may target allies as well.

tutorial_mainui_04_egoinfo_page_05_desc_.content:
You can force activate an E.G.O Corrosion Skill by Overclocking, which consumes 1.5 times as many E.G.O Resources and SP as the E.G.O Skill's usual cost. This is called E.G.O Overclock.
E.G.O Overclock can be activated by pressing and holding the E.G.O Card in the E.G.O Skill selection menu in combat.
Stable E.G.O Overclock Skill will be activated if there are enough E.G.O Costs(1.5 times the usual cost) at hand. Stable E.G.O Overclock Skill is able to distinguish allies from foes.
If there aren't enough E.G.O Costs at hand, Unstable E.G.O Overclock Skill will be activated instead. Unstable E.G.O Overclock Skill does not distinguish allies from foes.

tutorial_mainui_04_egoinfo_page_06_desc_.content: Using an E.G.O Skill will activate the E.G.O's Passive.

tutorial_mainui_04_egoinfo_page_07_desc_.content: The color of each Skill Icon corresponds to a Sin Affinity of the same color. These are the following Sin Affinities: Wrath, Lust, Sloth, Gluttony, Gloom, Pride, and Envy.

tutorial_mainui_04_egoinfo_page_08_desc_.content: On the bottom of a Skill Icon is its Attack Type. These are the following Attack Types: Slash, Pierce, and Blunt.
On the left of a Skill Icon is its Base Power.
On the top of a Skill Icon is its Coin Power. These are the following Coin Power calculations: Plus, Minus, and Multiply.

tutorial_mainui_04_egoinfo_page_09_desc_.content: The number of Coins for this Skill is displayed here.
The Skill's Offense Level and its modifier are displayed here. The difference in the Attack Skill's Offense Level and the target's Defense Level can greatly affect the amount of damage dealt.
The Skill's Atk Weight is displayed here. Higher Atk Weight will target more enemies. (e.g. 1 Atk Weight will target 1 enemy, 3 Atk Weight will target 3 enemies)

tutorial_mainui_04_egoinfo_page_10_desc_.content: Skills may have effects that activate when the stated conditions are met.
Skills may have effects that activate when the stated Coin conditions(e.g. Heads Hit, Tails Hit) are met. Coin effects will not activate when the conditions aren't met.

tutorial_mainui_05_storymain_page_01_des.content: You can view past parts of the story here. Select a Canto.

tutorial_mainui_05_storymain_page_02_des.content: Choose the scene you’d like to view.

tutorial_mainui_05_storymain_page_03_des.content: You can also check what stage the scene originally played in.

tutorial_mainui_06_storyidentity_page_01.content: You can read up on the profiles and stories of your Sinners. Select a Sinner.

tutorial_mainui_06_storyidentity_page_02.content: You can select from the Sinner’s listed Identities.

tutorial_mainui_06_storyidentity_page_03.content: You can read the Identity’s story here.

tutorial_mainui_06_storyidentity_page_04.content: You can view the Identity’s lines or their story.

tutorial_mainui_07_storymirror_page_01_d.content: Upon selection, you’ll be taken to the list of Mirror Worlds.
In the Mirror Worlds, the various Identity stories are categorized in accordance with the reflection they come from. You can check each Mirror World and the factions that appear in it.

tutorial_mainui_07_storymirror_page_02_d.content: Read each Identity’s story based on the Mirror World.

tutorial_mainui_08_stagemain_page_01_des.content: You choose a stage to enter.

tutorial_mainui_08_stagemain_page_02_des.content: After you’ve won the battle, the stage will be marked as cleared.
If you clear the EX Objectives, you’ll earn bonus rewards, and the stage will be marked accordingly.

tutorial_mainui_08_stagemain_page_03_des.content: You can rewatch the story scenes featured in the stage as well.
You can view the blurb and description for the stage here.
You can read up on the enemies that appear. Information on certain powerful enemies will only be available after encountering them.

tutorial_mainui_08_stagemain_page_05_des.content: Each stage has a limit to the number of participants.

tutorial_mainui_09_stagedungeon_page_01_.content: A dungeon awaits at the tail end of each episode. Entering dungeons costs Enkephalin Modules.

tutorial_mainui_09_stagedungeon_page_02_.content: You proceed by moving to spaces adjacent to your location. You may find encounters with various foes and also events with consequences.

tutorial_mainui_09_stagedungeon_page_03_.content: The HP, SP, and lost lives of your Sinners will carry over between encounters.
When you reach a checkpoint, your Sinners will be fully healed.

tutorial_mainui_09_stagedungeon_page_04_.content: As you explore the dungeon, you may acquire E.G.O Gifts; these items offer powerful effects that last until the end of the exploration.
A dungeon consists of multiple floors. You may proceed down after securing the space containing stairs.

tutorial_mainui_10_mirrordungeon_page_01.content: You can choose one of the various Mirror Dungeons to enter. Claiming Mirror Dungeon Rewards costs Enkephalin Modules.

tutorial_mainui_10_mirrordungeon_page_02.content: You can check the list of E.G.O Gifts that appear in the Mirror Dungeon. Certain E.G.O Gifts need to be unlocked by fulfilling specific conditions.

tutorial_mainui_10_mirrordungeon_page_03.content: When you enter a Mirror Dungeon, you’ll be offered a random selection of E.G.O Gifts to help the exploration. Choose one to take with you.

tutorial_mainui_10_mirrordungeon_page_04.content: Make a team of three Sinners to carry out the exploration.

tutorial_mainui_10_mirrordungeon_page_05.content: Select Identities for the Sinners. In Mirror Dungeons, all Identities start at Level 10, and can be powered up as you progress.

tutorial_mainui_10_mirrordungeon_page_06.content: Choose E.G.O for your Sinners to equip. You can only select ZAYIN-grade E.G.O during deployment.

tutorial_mainui_10_mirrordungeon_page_07.content: The layouts and paths in Mirror Dungeons are randomly generated each time you enter. Proceed by moving to one of the adjacent spaces in the next sector, and deal with the encounters and events waiting for you.

tutorial_mainui_10_mirrordungeon_page_08.content: As you explore the dungeon, you may acquire E.G.O Gifts; these items offer powerful effects that last until the end of the exploration.
The HP, SP, and lost lives of your Sinners will carry over between encounters.

tutorial_mainui_10_mirrordungeon_page_09.content: Certain events allow you to add more Sinners to your team.
In Mirror Dungeons, Identities power up in steps as you progress. Level up and equip more E.G.O through combat encounters and events.

tutorial_mainui_10_mirrordungeon_page_10.content: You’ll be rewarded upon clearing the dungeon, and a bonus will be given for a set number of times each week. The amount of rewards is proportional to the number of spaces cleared.

tutorial_mainui_11_extraction_page_01_de.content: You may choose between Standard and Target Extractions.
You can spend Lunacy to extract Identities or E.G.O.

tutorial_mainui_11_extraction_page_02_de.content: You can see how long the limited Extraction banner will last.
View details on the featured Identity or E.G.O here.

tutorial_mainui_11_extraction_page_03_de.content: You can view records of your previous Extractions here.
You can view the likelihood of the featured Identity or E.G.O being extracted.

tutorial_mainui_11_extraction_page_04_de.content: When you get an Identity you already own, you’ll receive Egoshards based on its rarity.

tutorial_mainui_12_vendingmachine_page_0.content: You can exchange Egoshards for Identities or E.G.O you don’t yet own.
You can purchase permanently available Identities and E.G.O, as well as those from past seasons.
To buy Identities or E.G.O from here, you will need Egoshards of the Sinner.
Egoshards can also be exchanged for Thread.
Thread is used for the Uptying of Identities and Threadspinning of E.G.O.

tutorial_mainui_13_userinfo_page_01_desc.content: You can check your user info, list of support characters, and the friend list here.

tutorial_mainui_13_userinfo_page_02_desc.content: The User ID (UID) and account level are shown here.
You can configure your decorative banners.

tutorial_mainui_13_userinfo_page_03_desc.content: You can choose artwork to display from the Sinners in your possession.

tutorial_mainui_13_userinfo_page_04_desc.content: You can check the artwork of the Identities and E.G.O you own.

tutorial_mainui_13_userinfo_page_05_desc.content: Use a combination of given words and phrases to make your introduction.

tutorial_mainui_13_userinfo_page_06_desc.content: Choose from a given list of phrases and words to make your introduction.

tutorial_mainui_13_userinfo_page_07_desc.content: You can assign support Identities and E.G.O to assist others.

tutorial_mainui_13_userinfo_page_08_desc.content: You can check your friends’ IDs, banners, introductions, and log-in times; plus, add users as friends!

tutorial_mainui_14_battlepass_page_01_de.content: You can check and redeem level rewards for the free battle pass and the Limbus Pass.

tutorial_mainui_14_battlepass_page_02_de.content: You can check the title of the battle pass and its period.
You can check your battle pass level and progress here.

tutorial_mainui_14_battlepass_page_03_de.content: This shows the list of missions that reward you with battle pass progression upon completion. There are daily, weekly, and seasonal missions.

tutorial_mainui_14_battlepass_page_04_de.content: Once you’ve reached the maximum level for determined rewards on the battle pass, you will be given bonus rewards with each level up. Limbus Pass owners gain additional rewards.

tutorial_mainui_15_exp_dungeon_page_01_d.content: Choose a stage to enter based on the strength of your Sinners. Entering Luxcavation stages costs Enkephalin Modules.

tutorial_mainui_15_exp_dungeon_page_02_d.content: Enemies in EXP Luxcavation have specific resistances. You can check the type and Affinity that will be the most effective for each stage before entering.

tutorial_mainui_15_exp_dungeon_page_03_d.content: In EXP Luxcavation, you can acquire experience from combat and Identity Training Tickets, and you can earn bonus rewards for a set number of clears each day.

tutorial_mainui_16_thread_dungeon_page_0.content: Features different Abnormality battle stages depending on the day of the week. Entering Luxcavation stages costs Enkephalin Modules.
Enemies in Thread Luxcavation have specific resistances. You can check the type and Affinity that will be the most effective for each stage before entering.
Choose a stage to enter based on the strength of your Sinners.
In Thread Luxcavation, you can acquire Thread, and you can earn bonus rewards for a set number of clears each day.

tutorial_mainui_17_railway_page_01_desc_.content:
The Lines of the Refraction Railway run for a certain period of time.
You can enter the available Lines at no cost.

tutorial_mainui_17_railway_page_02_desc_.content: The Railway’s running time is displayed on the side of the Line.

tutorial_mainui_17_railway_page_03_desc_.content: You will choose a number of Identities and E.G.O to begin the expedition with.

tutorial_mainui_17_railway_page_04_desc_.content: Unlike other combat-based content, the level-ups and tier-ups done to your Identities and E.G.O while an expedition is in progress will not be immediately reflected on your team’s status.

tutorial_mainui_17_railway_page_05_desc_.content:
You may not change your team in the middle of an expedition. 
If you wish to modify your setup or reflect upgrades on your Identities and E.G.O, you must start a new expedition.

tutorial_mainui_17_railway_page_06_desc_.content: The Refraction Railway consists of 13 stages.

tutorial_mainui_17_railway_page_07_desc_.content: Every battle in the Refraction Railway will allow you to directly match ally skills against enemy skills, similar to Focused Encounters.

tutorial_mainui_17_railway_page_08_desc_.content: The E.G.O resources held after clearing a stage can be carried over to the next stage.
The HP, SP, and availability of your Identities are shown here.

tutorial_mainui_17_railway_page_09_desc_.content:
When you clear a stage, the Station will record the number of turns taken to beat it: Clear Turns.
As well as the cumulative number of turns taken throughout the current expedition: Total Turns.

tutorial_mainui_17_railway_page_10_desc_.content: The HP, SP, and availability of your Identities are shown here.

tutorial_mainui_17_railway_page_11_desc_.content: You can check the requirements for acquiring banners here.
You can acquire more lavishly ornamented banners as you meet more difficult conditions.

tutorial_mainui_17_railway_page_12_desc_.content: After clearing a stage in the Line for the first time during the event period, the rewards will be sent to the Lost & Found.

After clearing a stage in the Line for the first time during the event period, the rewards will be sent to the Lost & Found.
To gain access to the Lost & Found, a number of Enkephalin Modules will be required.
Afterward, you may freely access it and claim the rewards you’ve earned at no additional cost.

tutorial_mainui_17_railway_page_13_desc_.content:
Upon clearing the final stage, the records for the expedition will be saved.
Records of up to 20 expeditions are kept in the logs.
If more than 20 records are in the log, the ones with the highest Total Turns will be removed first; if the Total Turns are the same, then the death count acts as the next criterion.
If the death counts are identical as well, the older record will be removed.

tutorial_mainui_17_railway_page_14_desc_.content:
The Health and Sanity of your Sinners will carry over between stages.
However, after clearing a stage, those who did not participate in the battle will fully recover their HP and SP when entering the next stage.
Any Sanities above 0 will be maintained in either case.

tutorial_mainui_17_railway_page_15_desc_.content:
During an expedition, you can choose to start over from previously cleared Stations.
When you do so, the battle will start with the Sinners’ statuses and E.G.O resources reverted to that point, and any progress you've made since that Station will be reset.

tutorial_mainui_17_railway_page_16_desc_.content: When a Line of the Refraction Railway closes, the best total turn record will be etched on the lower side of that Line’s banner.

tutorial_mainui_18_hells_chicken_01_desc.content:
The [Hell’s Chicken Event Page] opens after clearing Stage 3-22 of the Main Story.
You may enter the event page via the banner on the Window or the Driverside.

tutorial_mainui_18_hells_chicken_02_desc.content: The duration of the Hell’s Chicken event is shown here. During the event, you can earn [Bongy Plushies] by clearing Stages and Dungeons in the event and Main Story.
※ Mirror Dungeons, Luxcavation, and the Refraction Railway do not give [Bongy Plushies].

tutorial_mainui_18_hells_chicken_03_desc.content:
Hell’s Chicken consists of 8 stages and 2 dungeons.
Said stages and dungeons also offer batches of [Bongy Plushies] as a first-time EX Clear bonus.
You can earn considerably more [Bongy Plushies] from Hell’s Chicken Dungeons compared to regular stages.

tutorial_mainui_18_hells_chicken_04_desc.content: Having Identities and E.G.O from the Hell’s Chicken event on your team increases the amount of [Bongy Plushies] earned from stages and dungeons.

tutorial_mainui_18_hells_chicken_05_desc.content: You can redeem various rewards from the [Coupon Trade-in] based on the number of [Bongy Plushies] you have.

tutorial_mainui_18_hells_chicken_06_desc.content: You can acquire event reward Identities and E.G.O, as well as various currencies from the [Coupon Trade-in].
The [Coupon Trade-in]’s open duration is shown here.

tutorial_mainui_18_hells_chicken_07_desc.content:
Hell’s Chicken Dungeons play similarly to Mirror Dungeons.
The dungeons come in two difficulties; their major traits are as follows.

tutorial_mainui_18_hells_chicken_08_desc.content:
Several E.G.O Gifts from the Mirror Dungeon will appear in the Hell’s Chicken Dungeon.
These E.G.O Gifts will assist event Identities and E.G.O to shine in their respective specialties.

tutorial_mainui_18_hells_chicken_09_desc.content: In the Hell’s Chicken dungeons, you begin expeditions with 5 Identities.

For player convenience, a preset function is being added for the Hell’s Chicken dungeons.
Using the preset button, you can quickly load the team setup you last used and make a swift entry.

tutorial_mainui_18_hells_chicken_10_desc.content:
The layouts and paths in the Hell’s Chicken dungeons are randomly generated each time you enter.
These dungeons consist of a single floor, and the final node always features the Hell’s Chicken boss.

tutorial_mainui_18_hells_chicken_11_desc.content:
There are special encounters and E.G.O Gifts unique to the Hell’s Chicken dungeons.
These specialties are marked with a unique icon below the node in the dungeon for easier identification.

tutorial_mainui_18_hells_chicken_12_desc.content: Even after the event fully ends, you will be able to experience the Hell’s Chicken combat encounters and view its story anytime at the Driverside - [Deviazione] and Theater - [Detour Tales].

tutorial_manual_1_season_information_01_.content:
When a new season begins, a new Battle Pass is introduced with it.
You can check the duration of the current season on the Battle Pass page.

tutorial_manual_1_season_information_02_.content: You can obtain currencies for the current season as well as E.G.O from the Battle Pass.

tutorial_manual_1_season_information_03_.content:
You can check the season an Identity or E.G.O belongs to below its name in the info tab.
Those without a season shown are categorized into the [Regular] tag.

tutorial_manual_1_season_information_04_.content: Season Info for Event Identities & E.G.O
Event Identities and E.G.O have [EVENT] marked next to their season tag.

tutorial_manual_1_season_information_05_.content:
Egoshards can be used for the notated period, matching the Season’s duration.

When a new Season begins, half of the previous Season’s Egoshards will be carried over, converted and rounded up for the new Season.

The carryover rates for unconverted Egoshards from multiple seasons past will be halved for each following Season.

The remaining Egoshards are converted into Thread.

tutorial_manual_1_season_information_06_.content:
Similarly to Egoshards, Egoshard Crates can be used for the notated period, matching the Season’s duration.

When a new Season begins, half of the Egoshard Crates (both random & nominable) will be carried over, converted and rounded up for the new Season.

The carryover rates for unconverted Egoshard Crates from multiple Seasons past will be halved for each following Season.

The remaining Crates are converted into Thread Crates.

tutorial_manual_1_season_information_07_.content:
A new Season’s Identities and E.G.O will be added to the list of Extractable items.
Identities from previous Seasons remain in the pool, so you can still acquire them from Extraction.
※ Event Identities & E.G.O from previous Seasons may appear from Sinner Target Extractions. (except those from the immediately preceding Season)

tutorial_manual_1_season_information_08_.content:
Identities and E.G.O from the new Season will become available at the Dispenser.
In addition, you will be able to exchange for Identities and E.G.O from the Battle Passes of past Seasons.
Please note that Extraction IDs belonging to the Season immediately before will be inaccessible until 2 Seasons have passed.

tutorial_mainui_19_mirrordungeon_desc_01.content:
You can choose a Mirror Dungeon from the list to enter.
Only one expedition can be carried out at a time; if you want to enter a different Mirror Dungeon while an expedition is in progress, you need to clear or forfeit the ongoing expedition first.
Each Mirror Dungeon (excluding Mirror of the Beginning) has two difficulty modes: Normal and Hard.

tutorial_mainui_19_mirrordungeon_desc_02.content: Every week, you're given 3 Weekly Bonus eligibilities that grant you additional rewards for Mirror Dungeon expeditions when used.

tutorial_mainui_19_mirrordungeon_desc_03.content: Each Mirror Dungeon has requirements you need to meet to unlock.

tutorial_mainui_19_mirrordungeon_desc_04.content:
You can check the list of E.G.O Gifts that appear in Mirror Dungeons.
The ones you haven't obtained yet in Mirror Dungeon expeditions will be marked with "No Data".

tutorial_mainui_19_mirrordungeon_desc_05.content: When you enter a Mirror Dungeon, you’ll be offered a random selection of E.G.O Gifts to help the exploration. Choose one to take with you.

tutorial_mainui_19_mirrordungeon_desc_06.content:
You will select a team of Sinners to enter the Mirror Dungeon with.
Each Mirror Dungeon has its own size limit for the starting team.

tutorial_mainui_19_mirrordungeon_desc_07.content: You can view the E.G.O Gifts you currently have.

tutorial_mainui_19_mirrordungeon_desc_08.content: By using presets, you can load up Identity and E.G.O Teams you have set up in the 'Sinners' window.

tutorial_mainui_19_mirrordungeon_desc_09.content:
You can view the Cost in your possession here.
Cost is used when purchasing E.G.O Gifts from the shop, or when acquiring new Identities or E.G.O to have on your team at the shop or the rest stop.
On Normal difficulty, you are not given any starting Cost, but the initial team setup doesn't require any Cost.
On Hard difficulty, you're given a set amount of Cost to build your initial team with.

tutorial_mainui_19_mirrordungeon_desc_10.content:
Select Identities for the Sinners.
In Mirror Dungeons, all Identities are set at the level appropriate for the Dungeon.

tutorial_mainui_19_mirrordungeon_desc_11.content: Choose E.G.O to use for the selected Sinner.

tutorial_mainui_19_mirrordungeon_desc_12.content: After finishing up the initial team setup, press 'Confirm' to enter the Mirror Dungeon.

tutorial_mainui_19_mirrordungeon_desc_13.content:
The layouts and paths in Mirror Dungeons are randomly generated each time you enter.
Proceed by moving to one of the adjacent spaces in the next sector, and deal with the encounters and events waiting for you.

tutorial_mainui_19_mirrordungeon_desc_14.content:
As you explore the dungeon, you may acquire E.G.O Gifts.
These items offer powerful effects that last until the end of the exploration.

tutorial_mainui_19_mirrordungeon_desc_15.content: The HP, SP, and lost lives of your Sinners will carry over between encounters.

tutorial_mainui_19_mirrordungeon_desc_16.content: Below the combat encounter nodes in Mirror Dungeons, types and affinities effective against the enemies will be shown.

tutorial_mainui_19_mirrordungeon_desc_17.content: In Mirror Dungeons, there are Rest Stops where you may heal up for free, or spend Cost to gain an Identity or E.G.O to deploy on the team.

tutorial_mainui_19_mirrordungeon_desc_18.content: At Shops, you can purchase E.G.O Gifts, heal allies, recruit Identities or E.G.O, or power up selected allies using the Cost you earned from combat encounters.

tutorial_mainui_19_mirrordungeon_desc_19.content:
After clearing an expedition, you can spend Enkephalin Modules to claim rewards.
If you use the Weekly Bonus Eligibility count, you can earn large amounts of Battle Pass XP and some Lunacy.
The amount of rewards depends on the number of nodes cleared.

tutorial_mainui_19_mirrordungeon_desc_20.content:
Once the Hard difficulty of a Mirror Dungeon is unlocked, the Hard difficulty rewards count will be displayed above.
On Hard difficulty, you can earn more Battle Pass XP, but you may only claim the rewards 3 times per week.
The Hard difficulty rewards bonus and the weekly bonus apply independently; you can maximize your rewards by applying the weekly bonus to the Hard difficulty rewards.

tutorial_mainui_19_mirrordungeon_desc_21.content: Mirror of Mirrors and the Mirror Dungeons after it have starter buffs you can activate.

tutorial_mainui_19_mirrordungeon_desc_22.content:
Starter buffs can be activated using 'Starlight', providing various effects to aid your Mirror Dungeon expedition.
Starlight can be earned by playing Mirror Dungeons. Reaching further floors rewards more.
Starter buffs apply to both the Normal and Hard difficulties, but it does not affect other Mirror Dungeons.
You cannot use the Starlight from a Mirror Dungeon to activate starter buffs for other Mirror Dungeons.

tutorial_mainui_20_umida_01_desc_01.content:
[S.E.A Event Page] opens after clearing Stage 4-54 of the Main Story.
You may enter the event page via the banner on the Window or the Driverside.

tutorial_mainui_20_umida_02_desc_01.content: The duration of the S.E.A event is shown here. During the event, you can earn [Bus-modifying Scrap] by clearing Stages and Dungeons in the event and Main Story.

tutorial_mainui_20_umida_02_desc_02.content: ※ Mirror Dungeons and Luxcavation do not give [Bus-modifying Scrap].

tutorial_mainui_20_umida_03_desc_01.content:
S.E.A consists of 12 stages, including story stages.
Said stages also offer batches of [Bus-modifying Scrap] as a first-time EX Clear bonus.

tutorial_mainui_20_umida_03_desc_02.content: You can earn considerably more [Bus-modifying Scrap] from S.E.A stages compared to Main Story stages.

tutorial_mainui_20_umida_04_desc_01.content: Having Identities and E.G.O from S.E.A event on your team increases the amount of [Bus-modifying Scrap] earned from stages and dungeons.

tutorial_mainui_20_umida_05_desc_01.content: You can redeem various rewards from the [Scrap Box] based on the number of [Bus-modifying Scrap] you have.

tutorial_mainui_20_umida_06_desc_01.content: You can acquire event reward Identities and E.G.O, as well as various currencies from the [Scrap Box].

tutorial_mainui_20_umida_06_desc_02.content: The [Scrap Box]’s open duration is shown here.

tutorial_mainui_20_umida_07_desc_01.content: S.E.A does not feature a dungeon; instead, there's a special stage where you can earn larger amounts of [Bus-modifying Scrap].

tutorial_mainui_20_umida_07_desc_02.content: The special stage costs Enkephalin Modules to enter.

tutorial_mainui_20_umida_08_desc_01.content:
After winning a battle, you have a small chance to find [Rare Horseshoe with Bus-modifying Scrap].
The [Rare Horseshoe with Bus-modifying Scrap] is automatically converted to 20 [Bus-modifying Scrap].

tutorial_mainui_20_umida_09_desc_01.content: Even after the event fully ends, you will be able to experience combat encounters in S.E.A and view its story anytime at the Driverside - [Deviazione] and Theater - [Detour Tales].

tutorial_mainui_21_railway2_page_01_desc.content: Refraction Railway 2 does not consume resources to play. Select a Line to enter.

tutorial_mainui_21_railway2_page_02_desc.content: You will choose a number of Identities and E.G.O to begin the expedition with.

tutorial_mainui_21_railway2_page_03_desc.content: You cannot change your loadout while the expedition is in progress. Unlike other combat-based content, the level-ups and tier-ups done to your Identities and E.G.O while an expedition is in progress will not be immediately reflected on your team’s status.

tutorial_mainui_21_railway2_page_04_desc.content: Refraction Railway Line 2 consists of 9 Stations.

tutorial_mainui_21_railway2_page_05_desc.content: Rewards for clearing this Station are displayed below. Some Stations' rewards will unlock only after meeting certain Cycle Count conditions.

tutorial_mainui_21_railway2_page_06_desc.content: You can select up to 7 participants for an encounter. While you can select less than 7 combat participants, no additional Skill slots will be given for them throughout the encounter.

tutorial_mainui_21_railway2_page_07_desc.content: Every battle in the Refraction Railway will allow you to directly match ally skills against enemy skills, just like in Focused Encounters.
Upon completion, your Identities' HP, SP, Skills in the Dashboard, used Skills, and remaining Skills are saved.

tutorial_mainui_21_railway2_page_08_desc.content: The E.G.O resources held after clearing a Station can be carried over to the next Station.
Your Cycle Count and Total Turns up to this Station are displayed here.
The HP, SP, and availability of your Identities are shown here.

tutorial_mainui_21_railway2_page_09_desc.content:
Upon entering the next Station, information saved in the last Station will be loaded.
The Speed of allies & enemies are saved upon entering a Station.
The Speed of allies & enemies are saved upon entering a Station.

tutorial_mainui_21_railway2_page_10_desc.content:
Upon forfeiting a Stage, you will be returned to the state immediately before entering this stage.
Identities' HP, SP, Speed, Skills in the Dashboard, used Skills, remaining Skills, and enemy Speed at the state immediately before entering the Station will not be changed.
Identities' HP, SP, Speed, Skills in the Dashboard, used Skills, remaining Skills, and enemy Speed at the state immediately before entering the Station will not be changed.

tutorial_mainui_21_railway2_page_11_desc.content: Upon defeat, you can either return to the state immediately before entering that Station or continue using your surviving Identities.
Should you choose to continue, enemies' current HP will be saved. Their remaining HP percentages will be shown above the Station.

tutorial_mainui_21_railway2_page_12_desc.content: After clearing all open Stations on the Line, you can return to Station #1(First Stop) and continue the Cycle.
Should you choose to continue the Cycle, you will gain 1 Cycle Count. Some Stations will open only after reaching certain Cycle Counts.

tutorial_mainui_21_railway2_page_13_desc.content: At the end of every Cycle, you can choose 1 Ally Buff and 1 Enemy Buff.
All selected Buffs will carry over to the coming encounters.

tutorial_mainui_21_railway2_page_14_desc.content: Select 1 Ally Buff. You cannot select the same Buff you selected in the last Cycle.

tutorial_mainui_21_railway2_page_15_desc.content:
Select 1 Enemy Buff. You cannot select the same Buff you selected in the last Cycle.
However, if all Buffs had been selected at least once, selection limits will reset and you can select any Buff you want again.
Aside from the Buffs you select, every Cycle also gives 1 fixed Buff.

tutorial_mainui_21_railway2_page_16_desc.content: Every 5 Cycles, you will have a chance to revive one of your dead allied Identities.

tutorial_mainui_21_railway2_page_17_desc.content: If you have completed a Cycle (If you have 1 or more Cycle Counts), the Terminus in the middle of this Line will be activated.
Once the Terminus is activated, you can access it from any Station.

tutorial_mainui_21_railway2_page_18_desc.content: You cannot go back to the previous Station once you enter the Terminus. Choose carefully.
The ultimate goal of Refraction Railway Line 2 is to complete the Terminus. Upon completion, your Cycle Count, Total Turns, participating Identities & E.G.O, and selected Buffs will be recorded.

tutorial_mainui_21_railway2_page_19_desc.content: You can check the requirements for acquiring banners here.

More special banners have harder acquisition conditions.
Upon acquisition of the banner, your best Cycle Count and Total Turn records will be displayed on them.
Upon acquisition of the banner, your best Cycle Count and Total Turn records will be displayed on them.

tutorial_mainui_21_railway2_page_20_desc.content: After clearing a stage in the Line for the first time or meeting a certain condition, the rewards will be sent to the Lost & Found.

To gain access to a reward for the first time at Lost & Found, a number of Enkephalin Modules will be required.
Afterward, you may freely access it and claim rewards you’ve earned at no additional cost.

tutorial_mainui_21_railway2_page_21_desc.content: Upon clearing the final stage, your Refraction Railway play record will be saved. Up to 20 records can be viewed.

When you have made more than 20 records, records with the least Cycle Count will be deleted first. If there are two lowest records with the same Cycle Count, the one with a higher Total Turn Count will be deleted.

tutorial_mainui_22_railway2_page_1_desc_.content: Upon clearing all open Stations on the Line, a button to continue to the next Line will appear.

tutorial_mainui_22_railway2_page_2_desc_.content: You can take the Line to return to Station #1(First Stop).
In this process, you will gain 1 Cycle Count, and be asked to select 1 Ally Buff and 1 Enemy Buff that will be applied to the upcoming encounters.

tutorial_mainui_22_railway2_page_3_desc_.content: At the end of every Cycle, you can choose 1 Ally Buff and 1 Enemy Buff.
All selected Buffs will carry over to the coming encounters.

tutorial_mainui_22_railway2_page_4_desc_.content: Select 1 Ally Buff. You cannot select the same Buff you selected in the last Cycle.

tutorial_mainui_22_railway2_page_5_desc_.content:
Select 1 Enemy Buff. You cannot select the same Buff you selected in the last Cycle.
However, if all Buffs had been selected at least once, selection limits will reset and you can select any Buff you want again.
Aside from the Buffs you select, every Cycle also gives 1 fixed Buff.

tutorial_mainui_22_railway2_page_6_desc_.content: Once you've selected your Buffs, take the Line to Station #1(First Stop). Some Stations will open only after reaching certain Cycle Counts.
After completing a Cycle, the Terminus in the middle of the Line will be activated. A button to enter the Terminus will also be activated.

tutorial_mainui_23_railway2_page_1_desc_.content: You cannot go back to the previous Station once you enter the Terminus. Choose carefully.
The ultimate goal of Refraction Railway Line 2 is to complete the Terminus. Upon completion, your Cycle Count, Total Turns, participating Identities & E.G.O, and selected Buffs will be recorded.

tutorial_mainui_21_railway2_page_04_desc.content: Only 3 Stations will be open upon entry. Growing your Cycle Count will sequentially open the subsequent Stations (Station #4 ~ #8).

tutorial_walpurgisnacht_extraction_page_.content: Walpurgis Night Target Extractions will be available during the event period.
Walpurgis Night Target Extractions will have higher Extraction rates for Identities and E.G.O from the currently active Walpurgis Night event.

During the event period, Identities & E.G.O from the current Walpurgis Night event will be Extractable from other Extraction banners(save for Season relevant Extraction banners) as well.

However, their extraction rates will be identical to those of other Identities & E.G.O.

During the event period, previous Walpurgis Night Identities & E.G.O will be Extractable from all Extraction banners(save for Season relevant Extraction banners).

However, they will not receive increased rates for those Extractions.
Once the event period is over, Walpurgis Night Identities and E.G.O will no longer be Extractable.

tutorial_walpurgisnacht_vendingmachine_p.content: During the event period, Identities and E.G.O from all previous Walpurgis Night events are available from the Dispenser.
Identities and E.G.O from the currently active Walpurgis Night event are not available from the Dispenser.

tutorial_mirrordungeon03_page_01_desc_01.content: Season 3's Mirror Dungeon is called 'Mirror of the Lake'.

tutorial_mirrordungeon03_page_01_desc_02.content: Choose between 'Normal' and 'Hard' difficulties to enter.

tutorial_mirrordungeon03_page_02_desc_01.content: Every week, Mirror Dungeons offer Weekly Bonuses. Use Weekly Bonuses when you're claiming the rewards for the run—and receive greatly increased rewards.

tutorial_mirrordungeon03_page_02_desc_02.content: 'Normal' difficulty offers 3 Weekly Bonuses, and 'Hard' difficulty offers 1 Weekly Bonus.

tutorial_mirrordungeon03_page_02_desc_03.content: Clearing the 'Hard' Difficulty Mirror Dungeon will allow you to spend the rest of the Normal Difficulty Weekly Bonuses as well, maximizing the amount of rewards you gain from the Mirror Dungeon.

tutorial_mirrordungeon03_page_03_desc_01.content: You can view your currently deployed Sinners here.

tutorial_mirrordungeon03_page_03_desc_02.content: Collect Starlight from completing Mirror Dungeons and use them to obtain several Starter Buffs that will help you in the Mirror Dungeon.

tutorial_mirrordungeon03_page_03_desc_03.content: You can view the list of E.G.O Gifts that appear in the Mirror Dungeon. Obtaining an E.G.O Gift in the Mirror Dungeon will add an entry to your E.G.O Gift Compendium.

tutorial_mirrordungeon03_page_04_desc_01.content: In Mirror of the Lake, you can increase your chances of obtaining higher Tier E.G.O Gifts during your Mirror Dungeon run by activating more Starter Buffs.

tutorial_mirrordungeon03_page_04_desc_02.content: Starter Buffs do not change with the Mirror Dungeon difficulties.

tutorial_mirrordungeon03_page_04_desc_03.content: You can obtain Starlight from completing Mirror Dungeon runs.

tutorial_mirrordungeon03_page_04_desc_04.content: The higher you rise through the Mirror Dungeon floors, the more Starlight you will obtain.

tutorial_mirrordungeon03_page_05_desc_01.content: Upon Mirror Dungeon entry, you will be given 8 E.G.O Gift categories to choose from.

tutorial_mirrordungeon03_page_05_desc_02.content: You can choose as many E.G.O Gifts as it is available to you from the same category.

tutorial_mirrordungeon03_page_05_desc_03.content: E.G.O Gifts provide special effects in the Mirror Dungeon to assist you in your journey.

tutorial_mirrordungeon03_page_05_desc_04.content: You can obtain extra Starlight by choosing an E.G.O Gift category that you did not use in your immediately preceding run.

tutorial_mirrordungeon03_page_06_desc_01.content: Select Sinners who will participate in the Mirror Dungeon run.

tutorial_mirrordungeon03_page_06_desc_02.content: In the Mirror Dungeon deployment stage, all Identity Levels will be fixed to 40. In 'Hard' difficulty, your current Identity levels will be reflected instead.

tutorial_mirrordungeon03_page_06_desc_03.content: Deploy 1★ or 2★ Identities to gain additional Cost upon entry.

tutorial_mirrordungeon03_page_06_desc_04.content: Deploy Identities that have not been used in your immediately preceding Run to gain additional Cost upon entry.

tutorial_mirrordungeon03_page_07_desc_01.content: The deployed Identity's Rest Bonus will be completely exhausted upon clearing the Mirror Dungeon. The more Rest Bonus you exhaust, the more Starlight you will earn.

tutorial_mirrordungeon03_page_07_desc_02.content: However, Identities that have been swapped in or out during the Mirror Dungeon run will not spend their Rest Bonuses, and will not provide additional Starlight.

tutorial_mirrordungeon03_page_07_desc_03.content: Identities that did not spend their Rest Bonuses, and Identities that were not swapped in or out will gain 1 Bar of Rest Bonus.

tutorial_mirrordungeon03_page_08_desc_01.content: After finishing up the initial Team setup, press 'Confirm' to enter the Mirror Dungeon.

tutorial_mirrordungeon03_page_08_desc_02.content: This area displays the additional Cost you have gained over the deployment process.

tutorial_mirrordungeon03_page_09_desc_01.content: The Mirror Dungeon rooms and paths are randomly generated.

tutorial_mirrordungeon03_page_09_desc_02.content: You proceed by moving to nodes adjacent to your current node. You may find various events or combat encounters in each of the nodes.

tutorial_mirrordungeon03_page_09_desc_03.content: You will earn 'Cost' as you proceed through the Mirror Dungeon. 'Cost' you earned can be spent at Shops and Rest Stops.

tutorial_mirrordungeon03_page_10_desc_01.content: Acquired E.G.O Gifts are displayed here. E.G.O Gifts are items that offer powerful effects that last until the end of the Dungeon.

tutorial_mirrordungeon03_page10_desc_02.content: Below the combat Encounter nodes in Mirror Dungeons are types and affinities effective against the enemies in each node.

tutorial_mirrordungeon03_page_10_desc_03.content: The HP, SP, and lost lives of your Sinners will carry over between encounters.

tutorial_mirrordungeon03_page_11_desc_01.content: At Shops, you can spend your 'Cost' to purchase E.G.O Gifts, heal allies, deploy/swap out additional Identities or power up selected Identities.

tutorial_mirrordungeon03_page_11_desc_02.content: At Shops, you can sell E.G.O Gifts you don't use to obtain 'Cost'.

tutorial_mirrordungeon03_page_12_desc_01.content: At Rest Stops, you can spend your 'Cost' to heal allies, deploy/swap out additional Identities or enhance E.G.O Gifts.

tutorial_mirrordungeon03_page_12_desc_02.content: You can Fuse E.G.O Gifts to obtain different E.G.O Gifts.

tutorial_mirrordungeon03_page_13_desc_01.content: Upon clearing a floor, you will obtain random enemy buffs tied to each E.G.O Gifts.

tutorial_mirrordungeon03_page_13_desc_02.content: Enemy Buffs will continue to stack with every floor cleared.

tutorial_mirrordungeon03_page_14_desc_01.content: Upon clearing a Mirror Dungeon run, spend Enkephalin Modules to claim your rewards.

tutorial_mirrordungeon03_page_14_desc_02.content: The amount of rewards depends on the number of cleared Floors. You can use Weekly Bonus chances to claim even more rewards.

tutorial_mainui_24_miracle_01_desc_01.content: The [Miracle in District 20 Event Stages] opens after clearing Stage 5-36 of the Main Story. You may enter the event page via the banner on the Window or the Driverside.

tutorial_mainui_24_miracle_02_desc_01.content:
The duration of The Miracle in District 20 event is shown here. During the event, you can earn [Trinkets Sack] by clearing Stages and Dungeons in the event and Main Story.
※ However, [Trinkets Sack] cannot be obtained in Luxcavations.

tutorial_mainui_24_miracle_03_desc_01.content:
Miracle in District 20 consists of 13 stages, including story stages.
Said stages also offer batches of [Trinkets Sack] as a first-time Clear bonus.

tutorial_mainui_24_miracle_03_desc_02.content: You can earn considerably more [Trinkets Sack] from the Miracle in District 20 stages compared to Main Story stages.

tutorial_mainui_24_miracle_04_desc_01.content: Having E.G.O from the Miracle in District 20 event on your team increases the amount of [Trinkets Sack] earned from stages and dungeons.

tutorial_mainui_24_miracle_05_desc_01.content:
You can redeem various rewards from the [Gift Exchange] based on the number of [Trinkets Sack] you have.
You can collect up to 4,000 [Trinkets Sack].

tutorial_mainui_24_miracle_06_desc_01.content: You can acquire event reward Identities and E.G.O, as well as various currencies from the [Gift Exchange].

tutorial_mainui_24_miracle_06_desc_02.content: The [Gift Exchange]'s open duration is shown here.

tutorial_mainui_24_miracle_07_desc_01.content: Miracle in District 20 does not feature a dungeon; instead, there's a special stage where you can earn larger amounts of Trinkets Sack. The special stage consumes Enkephalin Modules.

tutorial_mainui_24_miracle_08_desc_01.content: There is a small chance to obtain a Huge Trinkets Sack upon clearing an Encounter. Huge Trinkets Sacks are automatically converted to 20 Trinkets Sacks.

tutorial_mainui_24_miracle_09_desc_01.content: Even after the event fully ends, you will be able to experience the Miracle in District 20 combat Encounters and view its story anytime at the Driverside - [Deviazione] and Theater - [Detour Tales].

tutorial_mainui_25_walpu2_01_title.content: The 2nd Walpurgis Night - The Dawn of Green

tutorial_mainui_25_walpu2_01_title_01.content: Unlocking The 2nd Walpurgis Night - The Dawn of Green

tutorial_mainui_25_walpu2_01_desc_01.content: [The 2nd Walpurgis Night - The Dawn of Green] unlocks regardless of your progress in the Main Story. Enter via the event banner on the Window or the Driverside tabs.

tutorial_mainui_25_walpu2_02_desc_01.content: The duration of The 2nd Walpurgis Night - The Dawn of Green event is shown here. During the event, complete Missions for Normal and Hard difficulty Dawn of Green Ordeal Encounters and claim their rewards.

tutorial_mainui_25_walpu2_03_desc_01.content: Select the door to begin the Normal difficulty Dawn of Green Ordeal. Dawn of Green Ordeal consumes an Enkephalin Module upon completion. In Normal difficulty, any deployed Identities under Level 40 will be raised to Level 40. However, your Identities' current Uptie Tiers and E.G.O Threadspinning Tiers will be reflected.

tutorial_mainui_25_walpu2_03_desc_02.content: Clearing the Normal difficulty Dawn of Green Ordeal unlocks the Hard difficulty. In Hard difficulty, your Identities' current Levels, Uptie Tiers, and E.G.O Threadspinning Tiers will be reflected.

tutorial_mainui_25_walpu2_04_desc_01.content: There will be a special, fixed Announcer for the Dawn of Green Ordeal Encounter. Therefore, you cannot select your own Announcers for this event Encounter.

tutorial_mainui_25_walpu2_04_desc_02.content: The #1 Sinner to be deployed in the Teams menu will be imbued with the 'Control Team Captain' effect. The Sinner with the 'Control Team Captain' effect will gain more Slots, their Skill composition will change, and will gain more beneficial effects.

tutorial_mainui_25_walpu2_05_desc_01.content: You can enter the [Missions] page, where you can view the list of Missions to be completed during the Encounter and their rewards.

tutorial_mainui_25_walpu2_06_desc_01.content: You can view the Reward Exchange period in the [Missions] page.

tutorial_mainui_25_walpu2_06_desc_02.content: Normal difficulty and Hard difficulty each has different sets of Missions to complete.

tutorial_mainui_25_walpu2_06_desc_03.content: Complete these Missions and claim various rewards from the [Missions] page.

tutorial_mainui_25_walpu2_07_desc_01.content: Even after the event fully ends, you will be able to experience the 'The 2nd Walpurgis Night - The Dawn of Green' combat Encounters and view its story anytime at the Driverside and Theater - [Detour Tales].

tutorial_mainui_railway3_page_01_desc_01.content: Select the activated Line to enter. Entering the Refraction Railway does not cost any currency or resources.

tutorial_mainui_railway3_page_02_desc_01.content: You will choose a number of Identities and E.G.O to begin the expedition with.

tutorial_mainui_railway3_page_03_desc_01.content: There are a total of 13 Stations in Refraction Railway Line 3. 10 of those Stations are combat Encounters.

tutorial_mainui_railway3_page_03_desc_02.content: Station #4, #8, and #12 are not combat Encounters. There, you can heal, revive, or change your Team Loadout.

tutorial_mainui_railway3_page_04_desc_02.content: Below each Station, you can view the rewards for clearing that Station. Claim them at the Lost & Found.

tutorial_mainui_railway3_page_05_desc_01.content: You can select up to 6 participants for an encounter. While you can select less than 6 combat participants, no additional Skill slots will be given for them throughout the encounter.

tutorial_mainui_railway3_page_06_desc_01.content: Every battle in the Refraction Railway will allow you to directly match ally skills against enemy skills, just like in Focused Encounters.

tutorial_mainui_railway3_page_07_desc_01.content: If you have already unlocked the Abnormalities' Observation Levels through the Story Dungeon Encounters, their Observation Levels will be reflected in the Refraction Railway and you can view their information as you would in those Dungeons.

tutorial_mainui_railway3_page_07_desc_02.content: However, the damage bonus based on Observation Levels do not apply in the Refraction Railway.

tutorial_mainui_railway3_page_07_desc_03.content: In Refraction Railway Line 3, the updated Observation Level will be saved even if you give up mid-Encounter.

tutorial_mainui_railway3_page_08_desc_01.content: The E.G.O resources held after clearing a Station can be carried over to the next Station.

tutorial_mainui_railway3_page_08_desc_02.content: Total Turns taken to clear the Station and Total Turns taken since the First Stop will be shown above each Station.

tutorial_mainui_railway3_page_08_desc_03.content: The HP, SP, and availability of your Identities are shown here.

tutorial_mainui_railway3_page_09_desc_01.content: Upon defeat, you can either return to the state immediately before entering that Station or continue using your surviving Identities.

tutorial_mainui_railway3_page_09_desc_02.content: Should you choose to continue, enemies' current HP will be saved. Their remaining HP percentages will be shown above the Station.

tutorial_mainui_railway3_page_10_desc_01.content: Select the Reset button to return to the state immediately before entering that Station.

tutorial_mainui_railway3_page_11_desc_01.content:
During an expedition, you can choose to start over from previously cleared Stations.
When you do so, the battle will start with the Sinners’ statuses and E.G.O resources reverted to that point, and any progress you've made since that Station will be reset.

tutorial_mainui_railway3_page_12_desc_01.content: Station #4, #8, and #12 are Rest Stations. Reaching those Stations will fully heal all allies and revive dead Identities.

tutorial_mainui_railway3_page_12_desc_02.content: Identities with 0 or positive SP will maintain their SP, but Identities with negative SP will recover to 0 SP.

tutorial_mainui_railway3_page_12_desc_03.content: You can also change your Team Loadout in Rest Stations.

tutorial_mainui_railway3_page_13_desc_01.content: You cannot go back to the previous Station once you enter the Terminus. Choose carefully.

tutorial_mainui_railway3_page_13_desc_02.content: Clearing the Terminus is the ultimate objective of Refraction Railway Line 3.

tutorial_mainui_railway3_page_14_desc_01.content: You can check the requirements for acquiring Refraction Railway Line 3 banners here.

tutorial_mainui_railway3_page_14_desc_02.content: You can acquire more lavishly ornamented banners as you meet more difficult conditions.

tutorial_mainui_railway3_page_14_desc_03.content: Upon acquisition of these banners, the Total Turns of your best record will be displayed on them.

tutorial_mainui_railway3_page_15_desc_01.content: After clearing a Station in the Line for the first time, the rewards will be sent to the Lost & Found.

tutorial_mainui_railway3_page_15_desc_02.content:
To gain access to a reward for the first time at Lost & Found, a number of Enkephalin Modules will be required.
Afterward, you may freely access it and claim rewards you’ve earned at no additional cost.

tutorial_mainui_railway3_page_16_desc_01.content: Upon clearing the final Station, your Refraction Railway play record will be saved. Up to 20 records can be viewed.

tutorial_mainui_railway3_page_16_desc_02.content: If you have more than 20 records, records with the highest Total Turns will be deleted first.

tutorial_mainui_26_ycgd_01_title.content: Yield My Flesh to Claim Their Bones

tutorial_mainui_26_ycgd_01_title_01.content: Unlocking Yield My Flesh to Claim Their Bones

tutorial_mainui_26_ycgd_01_desc_01.content:
The [Yield My Flesh to Claim Their Bones Event Page] opens after clearing Stage 5.5-12 of the Main Story.

You may enter the event page via the banner on the Window or the Driverside.

tutorial_mainui_26_ycgd_02_desc_01.content:
The duration of Yield My Flesh to Claim Their Bones event is shown here.

During the event, you can earn [Bloodied Scabbard] by clearing Event Stages and Event Dungeons. You can also earn [Bloodied Scabbard] by clearing the Mirror Dungeons or clearing Main Story Stages or Dungeons for the first time.

※ However, [Bloodied Scabbard] cannot be obtained in Luxcavations and Refraction Railways.

tutorial_mainui_26_ycgd_03_desc_01.content: Including Story Stages, the Yield My Flesh to Claim Their Bones event is composed of 12 Stages.

tutorial_mainui_26_ycgd_03_desc_02.content: You can earn considerably more [Bloodied Scabbard] from Yield My Flesh to Claim Their Bones Stages compared to Main Story Stages.

tutorial_mainui_26_ycgd_04_desc_01.content: Having Event Identities from the Yield My Flesh to Claim Their Bones event on your team increases the amount of [Bloodied Scabbard] earned from Stages and Dungeons.

tutorial_mainui_26_ycgd_05_desc_01.content: At the Reward Exchange window, you can submit [Bloodied Scabbard] you've collected to purchase various rewards.

tutorial_mainui_26_ycgd_06_desc_01.content: The duration to claim the rewards is shown here.

tutorial_mainui_26_ycgd_06_desc_02.content: Here, you can obtain various currencies and the Event Identity.

tutorial_mainui_26_ycgd_07_desc_01.content:
The final battle of Yield My Flesh to Claim Their Bones is like a Mirror Dungeon.

Entering the Dungeon costs Enkephalin Modules.

tutorial_mainui_26_ycgd_08_desc_01.content:
Rarely, you may obtain [Resentful Scabbard] from clearing Encounters.

[Resentful Scabbard] is automatically converted to 20 [Bloodied Scabbard] upon acquisition.

tutorial_mainui_26_ycgd_09_desc_01.content: Even after the event fully ends, you will be able to experience the Yield My Flesh to Claim Their Bones combat Encounters and view its story anytime at the Driverside - [Deviazione] and Theater - [Detour Tales].

tutorial_mainui_28_tkt_01_desc_01.content: The [Timekilling Time Event Page] opens after clearing Stage 6-48 of the Main Story.You may enter the event page via the banner on the Window or the Driverside.

tutorial_mainui_28_tkt_02_desc_01.content:
The duration of the Timekilling Time event is shown here.

During the event, you can earn [Pocket Watch] by clearing Event Stages. You can also earn [Pocket Watch] by clearing the Mirror Dungeons or clearing Main Story Stages for the first time.

※ However, [Pocket Watch] cannot be obtained in Luxcavations and Refraction Railways.

tutorial_mainui_28_tkt_03_desc_01.content:
Timekilling Time consists of 14 stages, including story stages, and a single dungeon.

Event Encounters also offer batches of [Pocket Watch] as a first-time Clear bonus.

tutorial_mainui_28_tkt_04_desc_01.content: Having Identities and E.G.O from Timekilling Time event on your team increases the amount of [Pocket Watch] earned from Stages and Mirror Dungeons.

tutorial_mainui_28_tkt_05_desc_01.content: You can redeem various rewards from the [Reward Exchange] based on the number of [Pocket Watch] you have.

tutorial_mainui_28_tkt_06_desc_01.content: You can acquire the event reward Identity and various currencies from [Reward Exchange].

tutorial_mainui_28_tkt_06_desc_02.content: The [Reward Exchange]'s open duration is shown here.

tutorial_mainui_28_tkt_07_desc_01.content: A Mirror Dungeon awaits at the end of the Timekilling Time event. Entering this Mirror Dungeon costs Enkephalin Modules.

tutorial_mainui_28_tkt_08_desc_01.content:
Rarely, you may obtain [Pocket Watch Bundle] from clearing Encounters.

[Pocket Watch Bundle] is automatically converted to 20 [Pocket Watch] upon acquisition.

tutorial_mainui_28_tkt_09_desc_01.content: Even after the event fully ends, you will be able to experience the Timekilling Time combat Encounters and view its story anytime at the Driverside - [Deviazione] and Theater - [Detour Tales].

tutorial_mainui_railway4_page_01_desc_01.content: Select the activated Line to enter. Entering the Refraction Railway does not cost any currency or resources.

tutorial_mainui_railway4_page_02_desc_01.content: Refraction Railway presents a series of very challenging battles.

tutorial_mainui_railway4_page_02_desc_02.content: We recommend that you Uptie your Identities to Tier 4, level them to Level 45, and Threadspin your E.G.Os to Tier 4.

tutorial_mainui_railway4_page_02_desc_03.content: We suggest that you enter the Railway after meeting the recommended conditions.

tutorial_mainui_railway4_page_03_desc_01.content: Choose a number of Identities and E.G.O to enter the Railway with.

tutorial_mainui_railway4_page_03_desc_02.content: If you level up, Uptie, or Threadspin your Identities or E.G.O outside the Refraction Railway, the changes will be applied to your characters in the Refraction Railway as well.

tutorial_mainui_railway4_page_04_desc_01.content: Refraction Railway Line 4 is composed of several Sections that tie several Stations into a single Stage. There are a total of 13 Stations.

tutorial_mainui_railway4_page_04_desc_02.content: There are four Combat Encounter Stages, each called a 'Section'; between each Section is a rest station.

tutorial_mainui_railway4_page_05_desc_02.content:
Clearing the Section will record your Clear Turn Count.

Below the Clear Turn Count is the Total Turn Count, which is the sum of all Clear Turn Counts from each Section.

tutorial_mainui_railway4_page_05_desc_03.content: Below each Section, you can view the rewards for clearing that Section. Claim them at the Lost & Found.

tutorial_mainui_railway4_page_06_desc_01.content: Refraction Railway Line 4 presents special buffs to your Sinners depending on their order of Deployment.

tutorial_mainui_railway4_page_06_desc_02.content: Certain Backup units receive additional Entry SP buffs. Minus Coin Identities will receive negative Entry SP buffs.

tutorial_mainui_railway4_page_07_desc_01.content:
Refraction Railway Line 4 introduces the 'Chain Battle' system.

In Chain Battles, when a Deployed unit is defeated, the Backup units will fill their spots in their own Deployment orders.

tutorial_mainui_railway4_page_07_desc_02.content: You can enter the Section only when you have selected both your Deployment units and the Backup units, six in each category.

tutorial_mainui_railway4_page_08_desc_01.content:
Every battle in the Refraction Railway will allow you to directly match ally skills against enemy skills, just like in Focused Encounters.
In Refraction Railway Line 4, the Sapling of Light ability can be activated once per every run.
Activation inside the Refraction Railway does not count toward the activation limit outside the Refraction Railway.

tutorial_mainui_railway4_page_09_desc_01.content: You can view the Deployment Order effects in the middle of an Encounter as well.

tutorial_mainui_railway4_page_09_desc_02.content: In Line 4, a defeated ally Identity will give E.G.O resources that correspond with the Sin Affinities of the Attack Skills on the defeated Ally. The amount of E.G.O resources given corresponds with the Rank of each Attack Skill. (S1 gives 1, S2 gives 2, S3 gives 3, for example)

tutorial_mainui_railway4_page_10_desc_01.content: When a Deployed unit is defeated, the Backup units will fill their spot in the Deployment order.

tutorial_mainui_railway4_page_10_desc_02.content:
When a Backup unit is Deployed into battle, its Combat Passive activates instead of its Support Passive.

When a Deployed unit is defeated, its Support Passive will activate instead of its Combat Passive.

tutorial_mainui_railway4_page_11_desc_01.content: In Line 4, ally death will not lower the other allies' SP.

tutorial_mainui_railway4_page_11_desc_02.content: Certain enemies in Line 4 will gain certain effects based on their Deployment orders.

tutorial_mainui_railway4_page_12_desc_01.content: If you have already unlocked the Abnormalities' Observation Levels through the Story Dungeon or Mirror Dungeon Encounters, their Observation Levels will be reflected in the Refraction Railway, and you can view their information as you would in those Dungeons.

tutorial_mainui_railway4_page_12_desc_02.content: However, the damage bonus based on Observation Levels does not apply in the Refraction Railway.

tutorial_mainui_railway4_page_12_desc_03.content: In Line 4, the updated Observation Level will be saved even if you give up or retry mid-Encounter.

tutorial_mainui_railway4_page_13_desc_01.content: The E.G.O resources held after clearing a Station can be carried over to the next Section.

tutorial_mainui_railway4_page_13_desc_02.content: The HP, SP, and availability of your Identities are shown at the bottom of the screen.

tutorial_mainui_railway4_page_14_desc_01.content: Stopping by the Rest Stations, which are located between Sections, will fully heal your Identities and reset their Sp to 0.

tutorial_mainui_railway4_page_14_desc_02.content:
You can also change your Team Loadout in Rest Stations.

If you are having difficulty clearing a Stage, please note that a different Team may work better against certain enemies.

tutorial_mainui_railway4_page_15_desc_01.content: If all of your allies are defeated, you can choose between returning to the Team Loadout menu to change your Deployment orders, and immediately retrying the battle.

tutorial_mainui_railway4_page_16_desc_01.content: During an expedition, you can choose to start over from previously cleared Stages.

tutorial_mainui_railway4_page_16_desc_02.content: When you do so, the battle will start with the Sinners’ statuses and E.G.O resources reverted to that point, and any progress you've made since that Stage will be reset.

tutorial_mainui_railway4_page_17_desc_01.content: You can check the requirements for acquiring Refraction Railway Line 4 banners here.

tutorial_mainui_railway4_page_17_desc_02.content: Upon acquisition of these banners, the Total Turns of your best record will be displayed on them.

tutorial_mainui_railway4_page_18_desc_01.content: After clearing a Stage in the Line for the first time, the rewards will be sent to the Lost & Found.

tutorial_mainui_railway4_page_18_desc_02.content:
To gain access to a reward for the first time at Lost & Found, a number of Enkephalin Modules will be required.
Afterward, you may freely access it and claim rewards you’ve earned at no additional cost.

tutorial_mainui_railway4_page_19_desc_01.content: Upon clearing the final Stage, your Refraction Railway play record will be saved. Up to 20 records can be viewed.

tutorial_mainui_railway4_page_19_desc_02.content: If you have more than 20 records, records with the highest Total Turns will be deleted first.

tutorial_mainui_29_mowe_01_title_01.content: Unlocking Murder on the WARP Express

tutorial_mainui_29_mowe_01_desc_01.content: The [Murder on the WARP Express Event Page] opens after clearing Stage 0-4 of the Main Story. You may enter the event page via the banner on the Window or the Driverside.

tutorial_mainui_29_mowe_02_desc_01.content:
The duration of the Murder on the WARP Express event is shown here.

During the event, you can earn [Civilian Recov. Pack] by clearing Event Stages. You can also earn [Civilian Recov. Pack] by clearing the Mirror Dungeons or clearing Main Story Stages for the first time.

※ However, [Civilian Recov. Pack] cannot be obtained in Luxcavations and Refraction Railways.

tutorial_mainui_29_mowe_03_desc_01.content:
Murder on the WARP Express consists of 15 stages, including story stages.
Said stages also offer batches of [Civilian Recov. Pack] as a first-time EX Clear bonus.

tutorial_mainui_29_mowe_03_desc_02.content: You can earn considerably more [Civilian Recov. Pack] from Murder on the WARP Express Stages compared to Main Story Stages.

tutorial_mainui_29_mowe_04_desc_01.content: Having Event Identities and E.G.O from the Murder on the WARP Express event on your team increases the amount of [Civilian Recov. Pack] earned from Stages and Dungeons.

tutorial_mainui_29_mowe_05_desc_01.content: You can redeem various rewards from the [Reward Exchange] using the [Civilian Recov. Pack] you have collected.

tutorial_mainui_29_mowe_06_desc_01.content: The [Reward Exchange]'s open duration is shown here.

tutorial_mainui_29_mowe_06_desc_02.content: You can acquire event reward Identities and various currencies from the [Reward Exchange].

tutorial_mainui_29_mowe_07_desc_01.content: Certain Encounters in the Murder on the WARP Express event are Chain Battles. In Chain Battles, the Sinners will not lose their Sanity(SP) even if their allies are defeated.

tutorial_mainui_29_mowe_08_desc_01.content: Rarely, you may obtain [Fixer Recov. Pack] from clearing Encounters. [Fixer Recov. Pack] is immediately converted to 20 [Civilian Recov. Pack] upon acquisition.

tutorial_mainui_29_mowe_09_desc_01.content: Even after the event fully ends, you will be able to experience the Murder on the WARP Express combat Encounters and view its story at any time at the Driverside and Theater - [Detour Tales].

Frequently Asked Questions here.

faq_payment_title_1.content: How does the Monthly Lunacy Supply work?

faq_payment_desc_1.content: When you purchase the Monthly Lunacy Supply, you will be given 650 Lunacy upfront, and you become eligible to receive the daily rewards listed below for the following 30 days. When you purchase the Monthly Lunacy Batch, you will be given 130 Lunacy upfront, and you become eligible to receive the daily rewards listed below for the following 30 days. ■ Daily Rewards from Monthly Lunacy Supply: 65 Free Lunacy ■ Daily Rewards from Monthly Lunacy Batch: 39 Free Lunacy ※ NOTES 1) All rewards are provided through in-game mail. 2) The two monthly packs function separately. 3) The two monthly packs can be purchased again up to two times within their duration. (This duration can be extended up to 67 days.) 4) The daily rewards will not be provided for days when you do not log into the game.

faq_payment_title_2.content: I want to refund an item I purchased. How do I?

faq_payment_desc_2.content: You may request a refund within 7 days of purchase as long as you did not use the purchased item.

faq_payment_title_3.content: What are purchases I am able to refund?

faq_payment_desc_3.content:
Please understand that certain packs, period-based products, items that include bonuses, and other products that come immediately into effect upon purchase may be difficult to refund.
Otherwise, you may request a refund for items within 14 days of purchase as long as you did not use them.

faq_payment_title_4.content: Where can I see my purchase history or receipts?

faq_payment_desc_4.content: Using Google Pay 1. Enter Google Payment center (https://payments.google.com/) 2. Log in with the Google account used to make the purchase 3. Go to [Activity] 4. Select the transaction to examine 5. Check transaction ID (GPA. 0000-0000-0000-00000) Using App Store 1. Enter iTunes page (https://www.apple.com/kr/itunes/) 2. Log in and go to [Account] 3. Select [View All] in purchase history Using Steam 1. Enter customer support page (https://help.steampowered.com/) 2. Go to [Purchases] 3. Go to [View complete purchasing history] 4. Check the transaction

faq_payment_title_5.content: Multiple payments were made for one item.

faq_payment_desc_5.content: If you encounter an error where multiple payments are made for a single product, please send an inquiry to customer service with the purchase history and the receipt included.

faq_payment_title_6.content: I made a purchase, but the item hasn’t arrived. What should I do?

faq_payment_desc_6.content: If you have encountered an error where you failed to receive in-game items from your purchase, please send an inquiry to customer service with the receipt included.

faq_payment_title_7.content: My payment keeps failing to process, why is that?

faq_payment_desc_7.content:
The in-game items are currently sold through the Google Play Store and App Store, taking a variety of payment methods; there may be various causes for the issue.

■ Possible Solutions for Failed Transactions
1) Restart the game under a stable network connection
2) For problems with the account setting: 

Google Customer Support
Link: <color=#F8C200><u><link="https://payments.google.com/payments/u/2/home#oneTimePurchase">https://payments.google.com/payments/u/2/home#oneTimePurchase</link></u></color>

Apple Customer Support
Link: <color=#F8C200><u><link="https://expresslane.apple.com/GetproductgroupList.action">https://expresslane.apple.com/GetproductgroupList.action</link></u></color>

Steam Customer Support
Link: <color=#F8C200><u><link="https://help.steampowered.com/">https://help.steampowered.com/</link></u></color>

3) For problems with processing the payment:
- For issues with the payment method such as budget limits, you may consult customer support for the card company or the network provider.

faq_payment_title_8.content: An item’s listed price doesn’t match how much it actually costs.

faq_payment_desc_8.content:
Paid products in Limbus Company follow the policies of the respective store (Google Play Store, App Store, Steam) on which the game is hosted. The price of the items is as displayed.

However, please note that there may be minor differences in the sum of payment due to external factors such as exchange rates and fees depending on the means of payment.
